conclusion: Determine the distance between points A and B inside the tank given the largest range of external angles is 120°.
The tank wall has a thickness of 18 cm.
The refractive index of the tank wall material is √3.
The maximum external angle visible through the material is 120°.
Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2.
n1 = 1 (refractive index of air), n2 = √3 (refractive index of the tank wall material).
Determine the critical angle θc using Snell's Law: sin θc = 1/√3.
Relate the critical angle to the external angle: θe = 180° - 2θc.
Given θe = 120°, solve for θc: 120° = 180° - 2θc, θc = 30°.
Calculate the distance AB using geometry: AB = 2 × 18 × tan(30°).
The distance between points A and B inside the tank is 12√3 cm.
